meanings.definition: The state of being under a curse or condemned
meanings.sent1: The accursednesses of the haunted house made everyone too scared to enter.
meanings.sent2: The villagers believed the accursednesses of the old witch caused the bad harvest.
meanings.sent3: The children joked that the accursednesses of their math homework was the reason for their struggles.
meanings.sent4: The accursednesses of the abandoned graveyard seemed to seep into the surrounding town.
meanings.sent5: The accursednesses of the cursed amulet was said to bring misfortune to all who possessed it.

meanings.definition: The quality of being accursed or cursed
meanings.sent1: The accursednesses of the dark forest filled the villagers with dread.
meanings.sent2: The old legend spoke of the accursednesses that plagued the ancient castle.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the accursednesses of their friend's silly prank.
meanings.sent4: The accursednesses of the stormy night matched the sailor's ominous premonitions.
meanings.sent5: The accursednesses of the cursed ring was said to bring misfortune to its wearers.
